body:
That's not an IPython thing, that's a celery thing:
```
>>> from celery import task
>>>
>>> @task
... def t2():
...     raise "haylp"
...
>>> t2()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/bussonniermatthias/anaconda/envs/36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/celery/local.py", line 191, in __call__
    return self._get_current_object()(*a, **kw)
  File "/Users/bussonniermatthias/anaconda/envs/36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/celery/app/task.py", line 379, in __call__
    return self.run(*args, **kwargs)
  File "<stdin>", line 3, in t2
TypeError: exceptions must derive from BaseException
>>> @task
... def t2():
...     raise Exception("haylp")
...
>>> t2()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/bussonniermatthias/anaconda/envs/36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/celery/local.py", line 191, in __call__
    return self._get_current_object()(*a, **kw)
  File "/Users/bussonniermatthias/anaconda/envs/36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/celery/app/task.py", line 379, in __call__
    return self.run(*args, **kwargs)
  File "<stdin>", line 3, in t2
TypeError: exceptions must derive from BaseException
```

It seem you can't reuse the same task name. Rename to t3 and it works. 
It celery have state, you need to clear its state.

Try your example without `@task`, and it work as expected.  So I don't think we can do anything.
Hrm, I didn't consider that. Thanks for your time.
